intro: Lessingia glandulifera var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The species is characterized by its glandular leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. The plant has small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
